intro: Schizoglossum scyphostigma, commonly known as the scarlet star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, strap-like leaves and produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil. Schizoglossum scyphostigma is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and its resilience to drought conditions.
